page.title: 12MOORSHOLM AND HEALTH
page.content: There is a Dr's surgery in the Plough Hotel 1 morning/week, served by Drs. from the Skelton Practice 1o km away. No public transport direct to the main surgery. Liverton is served by the Loftus Health Centre and has no village surgery or public transport to Loftus surgery. Apart from the usual ailments there is a high incidence of osteoarthritic hips (Almost twice national average) requiring arthoplasty. Moorsholm changed from spring to mains water in 1958 as spring pressure was too low for modern farming techniques and had to be chlorinated by law. Water is electrically pumped to top of Birk Brow and then gravity fed. Sewage treated at village farm and discharged in Hag Wood Stream. Liverton is supplied from Scaling Dam and sewage discharged via Loftus.
